requirement: Ground holding phase: before takeoff and after complete landing, the aircraft is in a stationary state.

The system should monitor the position and attitude of the aircraft while it is in parking status, preventing any unauthorized movement or adjustment.
The system should implement physical and electronic Safety measures to prevent unauthorized personnel from approaching or operating it.

requirement: Takeoff ground segment (takeoff run segment): Control the aircraft's lateral deviation and yaw angle relative to the runway centerline through differential braking and rudder deflection, and control the aircraft longitudinally according to the given pitch angle.

The system should verify the pitch angle control to ensure it meets the given pitch angle requirements and trigger corrective actions when the deviation exceeds the threshold.
The system should have redundant control mechanisms to ensure that the aircraft can still maintain stability and Safety even if the brakes or rudder control fail.

requirement: Takeoff departure segment: from when altitude and airspeed reach certain values to Safety altitude, primarily controlling the aircraft to climb at a specific pitch angle.

The system should continuously check the flight attitude during climbing, ensuring the pitch angle remains within a safe range to prevent stalling or excessive climbing.
The system should automatically adjust the flight control parameters when it reaches a safe altitude, ensuring a smooth transition of the aircraft to the cruising state.
The system should immediately trigger an alarm and take corrective actions when it detects abnormalities in altitude or airspeed, ensuring Safety.

The system should detect abnormal conditions during the retraction of flaps and landing gear and trigger emergency response mechanisms if necessary.

requirement: Climb phase 2: from flap retraction to reaching the required cruise altitude, or from one altitude to a higher altitude, longitudinal control is maintained at a given airspeed, and lateral control of the aircraft ensures it follows the pre-programmed route.

The system should continuously monitor the flight status during climbing to ensure that any abnormal conditions are detected and handled in a timely manner.

requirement: Command control mode is a control mode where the aircraft's flight status or position is changed through command control based on actual conditions during cruising.

requirement: The command control mode does not alter the control law structure under autonomous control mode.

The system should record all operations of control mode switching to track and audit the integrity of the control law structure.

The system should log the execution of all lateral commands for subsequent audit and troubleshooting.

requirement: Supports command control modes such as "left orbit", "right orbit", "figure-eight flight", "temporary waypoints", and longitudinally "fixed altitude", "altitude setting", as well as speed control with "fixed speed" and "speed setting".
safety_requirements: The system must ensure that when it receives commands such as 'left turn', 'right turn', 'figure-eight flight', and 'temporary waypoints', the adjustments to the aircraft's attitude and heading comply with Safety flight regulations.

The system should monitor the flight altitude and speed in real time when executing longitudinal control commands such as 'altitude hold', 'altitude setting', 'speed hold', and 'speed setting' to ensure they are within the Safety range.

The system should have an instruction verification mechanism to ensure that received instructions come from legitimate and authorized control sources.
The system should continuously monitor the flight status during command execution and immediately take Safety measures or trigger an alarm when an anomaly is detected.

requirement: Flight control and management software needs to support softened processing functionality
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the reliability of the softening processing function to avoid distortion or delay of flight control commands caused by the softening processing.

The softening treatment function should be subject to permission control, ensuring that only authorized users or systems can enable or adjust the softening treatment parameters.

The system should continuously monitor the flight status after switching to command control mode, ensuring that the flight path and attitude meet the predefined Safety standards.

requirement: In command control mode, commands of the same type can be resent, with the new command replacing the old one.

The system should log all issued commands and their status for auditing and troubleshooting as needed.
The system should immediately terminate the execution of old instructions upon receiving new ones and confirm that the new instructions have been successfully applied.

requirement: The control laws used in command control mode are exactly the same as those used in autonomous control mode.

The system should monitor the execution process of the control laws, preventing unauthorized modifications or deviations to ensure the integrity of the control laws.
During the switching of control modes, the system should perform a status check to ensure a seamless transition of control laws, avoiding system instability or failure.

The system should monitor in real time the consistency between the given altitude and the current flight altitude, and trigger a corrective mechanism when a deviation is detected.
The system should prevent unauthorized modifications or tampering with the 'set altitude' commands and given altitude data, ensuring the integrity and accuracy of the data.

The system should monitor the given altitude value in the flight control laws to ensure it remains consistent during the flight and triggers an alarm when there are abnormal changes.

The system should ensure data integrity and consistency during the update and transmission of airspeed values in 'speed setting' mode, preventing data from being tampered with or lost.

The system should log the execution of all "cancel altitude hold", "cancel speed hold", and "resume course" commands for audit and troubleshooting purposes.

The system should record all operations of switching the remote control modes, including the time, operator identity, and reason for the switch, to facilitate subsequent audits and traceability.

The system should have a mechanism for integrity verification of route data to prevent route data from being tampered with or damaged.

The system should continuously evaluate the impact of external environmental factors (such as wind speed, weather, etc.) on the flight path during the flight and make corresponding adjustments to ensure Safety.
The system should have the capability to re-plan routes in emergencies to ensure Safety during return or landing under sudden circumstances.

requirement: The system should longitudinally control the aircraft's airspeed and laterally control the side deviation during the descent phase, ensuring the aircraft descends to the desired altitude along the pre-programmed route at the given airspeed.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor airspeed and cross-track distance in real time to ensure control accuracy and stability during the descent phase.
The system should automatically adjust control parameters and trigger a warning mechanism when the airspeed or lateral deviation deviates from the preset range.
The system should ensure the accuracy of route tracking during the descent phase to prevent the aircraft from deviating from the pre-programmed route.
The system should have a fault detection function to activate backup control strategies promptly when control failure or sensor abnormalities occur.

requirement: The system should control the aircraft to maintain a constant altitude during the final approach segment and report the flight phase as the final approach when the navigation mode is set to final approach navigation, using the same control method as in the constant altitude segment.

The system should ensure a smooth transition when switching control modes between the five-sided flight segment and the fixed-altitude segment, avoiding sudden changes in flight status.
The system should immediately trigger an alarm and take corrective actions when it detects high control anomalies or navigation mode errors.
