The system should monitor data consistency in real time during the switching process of different altitude types, ensuring that the softened data matches the current flight status, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should record data changes during the process of switching altitude types, ensuring the traceability and non-repudiation of the data.

requirement: The softening of rudder deflection commands and throttle bias commands when switching to surface remote control.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure a smooth softening process of rudder deflection commands and throttle bias commands during the remote switching of control surfaces, avoiding sudden changes that could lead to system instability.

The system should monitor the rudder deflection commands and throttle valve deflection commands in real time during the switching process, ensuring their values are within the Safety range, and immediately stop the switching and issue an alarm in case of abnormalities.
The system should record key parameters during the switching process for traceability and analysis in case of a failure.

requirement: During the phase transition processing in non-remote control mode, a series of phase transitions may occur until the flight phase适应 the current state is reached.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that during the phase transitions in non-remote control mode, the transition logic of each phase is correct and conforms to the current flight status.
The system should monitor the phase transition process in real time, detect and handle any abnormal transitions to ensure flight Safety.
The system should maintain monitoring of critical flight parameters during phase transitions to prevent flight anomalies caused by errors in phase transition.

requirement: The softening of the given attitude angles (Jg, Yg, yg) when switching from autonomous rotation remote control to attitude remote control and back to autonomous.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the given attitude angles (Jg, Yg, yg) remain stable during the transition from autonomous to remote control or from remote control to autonomous, avoiding sudden changes or abnormal fluctuations.

The system should monitor the changes in attitude angles (Jg, Yg, yg) in real time to ensure that the softening process meets the preset Safety thresholds, and trigger an alarm or corrective mechanism when the thresholds are exceeded.

The system should perform consistency verification after the attitude angle softening is completed, ensuring that the softened attitude angle matches the target attitude angle to avoid error accumulation.

requirement: Softening of the given attitude angles (Jg, Yg, yg) during the landing rollout segment, and softening of the given attitude angles (Yg, yg) and throttle deflection commands during transitions in other phases.
safety_requirements: The system should perform real-time monitoring of the softening process in response to the given attitude angles (Jg, Yg, yg) and throttle valve bias commands, ensuring smoothness and accuracy during the transition.
The system should perform anomaly detection during the attitude angle softening process and immediately take corrective actions when anomalies are detected to ensure Safety.
The system should record the softening process of all attitude angles and throttle biases commands to facilitate traceability and analysis in case of anomalies.

requirement: The softening of the specified pitch angle when switching to the phase with an integrator in the longitudinal control law.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure a smooth softening process of the pitch angle during the switching phase to avoid sudden changes that can lead to flight instability.

The system should monitor the changes in pitch angle in real time, ensuring consistency with the integrator state of the longitudinal control law, and trigger corrective mechanisms in case of anomalies.
The system should record and verify all parameters during the softening process of the pitch angle, ensuring they comply with the predetermined Safety range and operating conditions.

requirement: The softening of the throttle valve bias command during climb to fixed altitude and descent to fixed altitude. During the transition from climb to fixed altitude, the initial value of the throttle valve control integrator is directly set to 100.0, and during the transition from descent to fixed altitude, the integrator initial value is directly set to 50.0.
safety_requirements: During the process of transitioning from climbing to a constant altitude or from descending to a constant altitude, the system should ensure that the softening process of the throttle deflection command is smooth to avoid instability in the flight condition caused by abrupt command changes.

When the system transitions from climbing to maintaining a constant altitude, it should verify that the integrator initial value for throttle control is accurately set to 100.0, and when transitioning from descending to maintaining a constant altitude, it should verify that the integrator initial value is accurately set to 50.0.
The system should perform real-time monitoring of the execution of the throttle valve bias command and trigger safety mechanisms when abnormalities are detected to ensure flight Safety.

requirement: When switching from attitude remote control to autonomous mode, the longitudinal control integrator is reset to zero. If it is in the altitude hold phase, the throttle control integrator initial value is directly set to 50.0.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the longitudinal control integrator is correctly reset to zero when switching from attitude remote control to autonomous mode, and maintain system stability during the transition.

During the altitude hold phase, the system should verify that the initial value of the throttle control integrator is 50.0 and prevent data tampering or incorrect assignment during the assignment process.

The system should monitor the state of the control integrator in real time when switching from attitude remote control to autonomous mode, ensuring there are no abnormal fluctuations or incorrect operations during the transition.

requirement: The softening of the throttle deflection command during the transition from climb to constant altitude is performed using both softening methods simultaneously, whereas the softening of the throttle deflection command during the transition from descent to constant altitude only uses the initial value softening method of the integrator.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that when the altitude hold transition is performed, the two softening methods of the throttle deflection command do not lead to command conflicts or anomalies when conducted simultaneously.

The system should ensure that when transitioning from descent to level flight, the integrator initial value softening method for the throttle bias command is accurately executed to avoid sudden command changes or failures. This approach enhances Safety.
The system should monitor in real-time the softening process of the throttle valve bias command and trigger a warning mechanism when there is an abnormality in softening.

requirement: To suppress the noise of the sensor and interference from external factors on the sensor's output data, it is necessary to perform filtering on some of the input sensor data.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the filtering algorithm can effectively suppress sensor noise to prevent data distortion.
The system should perform real-time detection of external disturbances and initiate filtering processing when abnormal disturbances are detected.
The system should regularly verify the effectiveness of the filtering algorithm to ensure its stability under different environmental conditions.
The system should perform an integrity check on the data after filtering processing to ensure that the data has not been tampered with or damaged.

requirement: A pre-filter is used to filter the input data, with the filter's cutoff frequency wc transformed through the Tustin bilinear transformation to obtain the filtering formula y(k) = a0y(k-1) + a1[x(k)+x(k-1)], where a0 and a1 take different values depending on wc.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the cutoff frequency wc of the前置 filter is within a reasonable range to prevent data distortion caused by over-filtering or under-filtering.

The system should monitor in real-time the calculation results of the filtering formula y(k) = a0y(k-1) + a1[x(k)+x(k-1)], ensuring its consistency with the input data, and trigger an alarm when anomalies are detected.
The system should regularly verify whether the values of a0 and a1 match the current cutoff frequency wc to ensure the correctness and Safety of the filter formula.

requirement: Different wc values are selected for different sensor data, and the corresponding a0 and a1 values also differ. See Table 3-21 for specific parameters.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accuracy and integrity of sensor data, preventing data tampering or loss.
The system should verify the selected wc, a0, and a1 parameters to ensure they comply with the specifications in Table 3-21.
The system should have an anomaly detection mechanism that triggers alerts and takes appropriate actions when sensor data or parameters become abnormal.

requirement: Using the vertical acceleration of the inertial navigation system to compensate for the rate of climb and descent of the radio altimeter and the atmospheric machine, in order to improve their accuracy.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the integrity and accuracy of the inertial navigation vertical acceleration data to prevent errors from being introduced during the compensation process.

The system should perform real-time verification of the compensation results for the radio altimeter's rate of climb and descent and the atmospheric machine's rate of climb and descent, ensuring that its accuracy meets Safety requirements.
The system should immediately stop compensation and trigger the warning mechanism when it detects abnormal vertical acceleration data from the inertial navigation.
The system should record all data used during the compensation process for audit and analysis if issues arise.

requirement: When the aircraft has already entered the descent phase, perform phase transition processing based on the current flight status.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the collection and verification of flight status during phase transition processing are accurate and error-free, avoiding misjudgments.
The system should monitor the flight status in real time to ensure that phase transition processing occurs only under safe conditions, preventing accidental transitions.
The system should maintain stability of flight control during phase transition processing to prevent abnormal flight attitudes caused by the transition.

requirement: The method of achieving combined filtering includes reading the vertical acceleration data from the inertial navigation system and applying it to the compensation calculations for the radio altimeter and the atmospheric pressure rate of climb or descent.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the integrity and accuracy of the vertical acceleration data read from the inertial navigation system, preventing the data from being tampered with or corrupted.

The system should perform real-time validation of the compensation calculation results applied to the radio altimeter and atmospheric pressure-based vertical speed, ensuring they are consistent with the current flight status.
The system should have a mechanism for handling abnormal data, and when abnormal data is detected, it should be able to promptly take corrective actions and trigger warnings.
The system should ensure the Safety of the combined filtering algorithm, preventing unauthorized modifications or interference.

requirement: The system needs to compensate for the atmospheric machine's rate of climb or descent based on vertical acceleration.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor vertical acceleration data in real time to ensure its accuracy and integrity, so as to correctly perform the compensation for the atmospheric machine's ascent and descent speeds.
The system should verify the lifting and lowering speeds after compensation to ensure they are within a reasonable range, and trigger an alarm when the preset threshold is exceeded.
The system should have a fault detection mechanism that can promptly take safety measures when atmospheric engine or sensor failures are detected, preventing incorrect compensation.

requirement: The system needs to compensate for the rate of climb/descent of the radio altimeter based on vertical acceleration.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accuracy and integrity of vertical acceleration data to prevent errors in radio altimeter climb and descent speed compensation.
The system should monitor the changes in vertical acceleration data in real time and trigger an alarm or take Safety measures when the data is abnormal.
The system should verify the compensation calculation to ensure that the rate of change of the radio altimeter after compensation is consistent with the actual flight status.
The system should have data backup and recovery functions to prevent the loss or damage of vertical acceleration data from affecting the compensation calculations.

requirement: The system needs to use the Tustin bilinear transformation to obtain a unified filter formula
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the implementation process of the Tustin bilinear transform complies with mathematical standards and algorithmic requirements, avoiding computational errors.
The system should perform real-time validation of the output from the filtering formula to ensure it meets the requirements for filtering performance and Safety.
The system should detect abnormal inputs or outputs during the application of the filtering formula and take corresponding Safety measures to prevent system failure.

requirement: The system needs to calculate the values of H1(k) and Hbc(k).
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the calculation process of H1(k) and Hbc(k) is not subject to unauthorized access or tampering.
The system should verify the integrity of the calculation results for H1(k) and Hbc(k) to ensure they have not been maliciously modified.
The system should achieve non-repudiation during the calculation of H1(k) and Hbc(k), ensuring the traceability of computational operations.
The system should provide real-time monitoring mechanisms to ensure that the calculation results of H1(k) and Hbc(k) are consistent with expected values, and trigger alerts when anomalies occur.

requirement: When H is set to Hb and Hr respectively, the system needs to calculate the compensated lifting speed Hbc, corresponding to uy and h respectively.
safety_requirements: The system should verify that the input values for Hb and Hr are within a reasonable range, ensuring that the calculated Hbc correctly corresponds to uy and h.
The system should perform real-time monitoring of the calculated Hbc to ensure it matches the current flight status, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should record the calculation process of Hb, Hr, Hbc, uy, and h to ensure that in the event of an error, the cause can be traced and analyzed.

requirement: The system needs to calculate the values of H1(k) and H2(k) according to the formula at each sampling period T=20ms.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the calculation process of H1(k) and H2(k) is not affected by external interference at each sampling period T=20ms, guaranteeing the accuracy and consistency of the calculation results.
The system should monitor the calculation results of H1(k) and H2(k) in real time, and immediately trigger an alarm or take corrective actions when abnormal values are detected.
The system should perform an integrity check on the formulas for calculating H1(k) and H2(k) to ensure that the formulas have not been tampered with or incorrectly applied.

requirement: Determine the flight phases under autonomous control, manual correction, and command control modes.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure the accuracy and consistency of the flight phases determined under autonomous control, manual correction, and command control modes.
The system should have a safety verification mechanism during mode switching to ensure that mode switching does not lead to incorrect flight phase judgment.
The system should monitor the flight phase in real time and trigger alarms and take Safety measures when anomalies or uncertain states are detected.
The system should record and verify critical data during the determination process of flight phases to ensure its integrity and non-tamperability.

requirement: The determination of flight phases in remote control mode (with inner loop remote control and without inner loop remote control) is different.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the logic for determining the flight phase in remote control mode is accurate, distinguishing between in-loop remote control and out-of-loop remote control.
The system should monitor the flight phases in real time during remote control mode to ensure that the determination of flight phases during mode switching is consistent with the current mode.
The system should perform anomaly detection for the flight phase in remote control mode, and trigger corresponding Safety mechanisms when inconsistencies are detected.

requirement: When switching between control modes, corresponding processing and phase determination are carried out.
safety_requirements: The system should perform an integrity check when switching control modes to ensure that the switching process does not lead to abnormal system status or data loss.
The system should record the time and status of control mode switches to facilitate追溯 and analysis in case of a failure.
The system should implement permission controls during mode switching to ensure that only authorized operations can trigger and control the mode switching.
The system should have a recovery mechanism in the event of a control mode switch failure, ensuring that the system can return to a Safety state or enter a standby mode.

requirement: If the flight altitude is greater than the decision altitude (40m), then control the aircraft to enter the go-around procedure.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the flight altitude in real time to ensure that when the flight altitude is greater than the decision altitude (40m), it accurately triggers the go-around procedure.
The system should verify the execution of the go-around procedure, ensuring it is performed as expected, and initiate backup mechanisms in case of execution failure.
The system should record the triggering and execution of go-around procedures for subsequent analysis and audit.

requirement: Softening of the given attitude angles, control surface commands, or throttle during phase transitions in flight and when switching control modes to enhance Safety.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure a smooth transition of attitude angles, control surface commands, and throttle softening during phase changes in flight, avoiding sudden control commands.

The system should monitor the softening process in real time when switching control modes, ensuring that the attitude angles, control surface commands, and throttle changes remain within the Safety range.
The system should have an anomaly detection mechanism. When anomalies are detected during the softening process, timely measures should be taken to restore the system to a safe state.

requirement: Select two softening methods: one for switching between control modes with inner loops or during flight phase transitions, and another for switching to remote control modes without inner loops.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the application of softening methods during switching between control modes or transitions in flight phases does not lead to abrupt changes in control commands or system instability. Safety is a critical concern in this process.

The system should verify the effectiveness and Safety of the softening method when switching the remote control mode without an inner loop, ensuring a smooth system response during the switching process.
The system should monitor the application of the softening method to ensure that it does not cause any anomalies or failures in the flight control system during the switching process.

requirement: The flight control system must have a notch filter function to attenuate the structural vibration mode signals of the aircraft, ensuring system stability.
safety_requirements: The flight control system should ensure that the notch filter function, when attenuating the signals of the aircraft structural vibration modes, does not introduce additional system instability factors. Safety is a critical consideration in this process.
The system should monitor the output of the notch filter in real time to ensure it effectively attenuates vibration signals within the target frequency range.
When the notch filter fails or its performance degrades, the system should trigger a fault handling mechanism to prevent threats to system Safety.

requirement: The elevator channel in the flight control system should include two notch filters, one located between the control law output and the servo loop, and the other after the pitch acceleration pre-filter.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the parameters of the notch filter are set according to the flight control requirements, avoiding signal distortion due to incorrect parameters.

The system should monitor the output of the notch filter in real time to ensure it is consistent with the control law output and the input of the elevator acceleration lead filter, and trigger an alarm in case of anomalies.
The system should have a notch filter failure detection function, which can automatically switch to the backup filter or trigger Safety mechanisms when the filter fails.

requirement: The notch filter parameters between the control law output and the servo loop should be set to x1z = 0.1, x2z = 0.6, wn1z = 24.3, wn2z = 24.3.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the notch filter parameters x1z, x2z, wn1z, and wn2z are not modified without authorization during the setup process.
The system should monitor the parameter settings of the notch filter in real time to ensure they match the specified values, and trigger an alarm mechanism when a deviation is detected.
The system should record the setup and modification operations of the notch filter parameters for auditing and traceability in case of a Safety event.

requirement: The specific parameters of the notch filter after the pre-filter for the lifting acceleration should be configured in the system.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the parameter configuration process for the lift acceleration pre-filter and notch filter has authorization control to prevent unauthorized modifications.
The system should log all modifications to the parameters of the lift acceleration pre-filter and notch filter to ensure an audit trail for operations.
The system should verify the validity of the configured notch filter parameters to ensure that they do not have a negative impact on flight Safety.

requirement: The pitch acceleration in the longitudinal control law during the flare phase needs to be processed by the pitch acceleration notch filter 2.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the processing results of the elevator acceleration notch filter 2 are accurate and consistent with the requirements of the longitudinal control law during the flare phase.
The system should monitor the output of the elevator acceleration notch filter 2 in real time and trigger corrective actions when anomalies are detected.
The system should record the processing of elevator acceleration notch filter 2 to facilitate subsequent audits and analysis.

requirement: The notch filter parameters for the aileron channel are x1x = 0.1, x2x = 0.6, wn1x = 24.3, wn2x = 24.3.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the notch filter parameters x1x, x2x, wn1x, and wn2x are correctly loaded at system startup and remain unchanged during operation.
The system should monitor the notch filter parameters x1x, x2x, wn1x, and wn2x in real-time to prevent unauthorized modifications and immediately take corrective actions when anomalies are detected.
The system should record the configuration and change history of the notch filter parameters x1x, x2x, wn1x, and wn2x to facilitate auditing and traceability when needed.

requirement: The parameters of the notch filter for the rudder channel are x1y = 0.1, x2y = 0.5999922, wn1y = 40.81997, wn2y = 25.11991.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the parameters x1y, x2y, wn1y, and wn2y of the notch filter for the rudder channel are not modified without authorization during operation.
The system should monitor the notching filter parameters of the rudder channel in real time to ensure their values match the preset values, and trigger an alarm when anomalies are detected.
The system should record all changes to the notch filter parameters of the rudder channel for audit and traceability.

requirement: The formula for the discretized notch filter obtained using the Tustin bilinear transformation is δd(k) = [- Kd12δd(k-1) - Kd22δd(k-2) + Kd01δ(k) + Kd11δ(k-1) + Kd].
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the calculation process of the discretization notch filter formula δd(k) is accurate, preventing filter failure due to calculation errors.
The system should perform real-time verification of the calculation results for δd(k) to ensure they meet the expected filtering effect, and trigger error correction mechanisms in case of anomalies.
The system should protect the integrity of the coefficients Kd12, Kd22, Kd01, Kd11, Kd of the discretized notch filter formula, preventing unauthorized modifications or tampering.

requirement: If the flight altitude is not greater than the decision altitude, then phase transition processing is conducted based on the current phase marker and flight altitude.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the trigger conditions for phase transition processing are accurate, and the transition only occurs when the flight altitude is not greater than the decision height.
The system should monitor the flight altitude and phase markers in real time to ensure the correctness and timeliness of phase transition processing.
The system should prevent unauthorized operations or interference during phase transition processing to ensure the Safety and stability of the system state.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the functionality of the acceleration notch filter 2, including parameter settings and filtering processing.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the parameter settings for the acceleration notch filter 2 comply with Safety standards, preventing unauthorized modifications.
The system should monitor in real time the filtering results of the acceleration notch filter 2 to ensure they meet the expected effects and trigger an alarm in case of abnormalities.
The system should log and verify the parameter settings and filtering process logs of the acceleration notch filter 2 to ensure the integrity and traceability of the data.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the notch filter function for the aileron channel, including parameter settings and filtering processing.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the Safety of the notch filter parameter setting process, preventing unauthorized modifications.
The system should perform real-time monitoring of the output of the notch filter to ensure that the filtered data meets expectations and triggers an alarm in case of anomalies.
The system should log all parameter settings and filtering processes for audit and troubleshooting.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the notch filter function for the rudder channel, including parameter settings and filtering processing.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accuracy and effectiveness of the notch filter parameter settings, preventing filter processing failure due to incorrect parameters.
The system should monitor the operation status of the notch filter in real time to ensure that it does not introduce additional noise or distortion during the filtering process.
The system should have the capability to detect abnormal notch filter parameters and automatically restore default settings or trigger an alarm when parameters are abnormal.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the Tustin bilinear transform discretization to generate a discrete notch filter formula.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accuracy and stability of all mathematical operations during the discretization process using the Tustin bilinear transform, avoiding a decrease in filter performance due to calculation errors.

The system should verify the generated discrete notch filter formula to ensure it meets the design requirements and trigger an error handling mechanism when formula generation fails or abnormalities occur.
The system should protect the integrity of data during discretization processing, preventing unauthorized tampering or data leakage.

requirement: The flaps are extended or retracted according to the needs of different phases of flight or remote control, with three deflection angles: 0°, 15°, and 40°.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the flaps accurately reach the three preset deflection angles of 0°, 15°, and 40° during retraction and extension, and lock upon reaching the target position.

The system should monitor the flap deflection angle in real time to ensure it is consistent with the current flight phase or remote control commands, and automatically correct when a deviation is detected.
The system should perform fault detection during the flap extension and retraction process, and immediately stop operation and trigger an alarm when a fault is detected.

The system should ensure that the operation of retracting and extending the flaps does not adversely affect flight stability, and adjust the flight control parameters as necessary to maintain stability.

requirement: The system should be able to automatically adjust the flap deflection position based on information provided by the phase of flight identification module.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the accuracy and completeness of the information provided by the flight phase identification module to ensure the reliability of the basis for adjusting the flap deflection angle.

The system should monitor the adjustment process of the flap deflection angles in real time to ensure it aligns with the requirements of the flight phase, and trigger an alarm in case of abnormalities.
The system should have a fault-tolerant mechanism for adjusting the flap deflection angle, ensuring that the flaps remain in a Safety position when information is abnormal or equipment fails.

requirement: The system should support remote control for manually adjusting the flap deflection angle position.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that only authorized users can manually adjust the flap angle position.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of the adjustment of the flap deflection angle, ensuring that the adjustment range is within safety limits, and automatically stop the adjustment when the limits are exceeded.
The system should log all manual adjustments of the flap deflection angle, including the operation time, operator, and the deflection values before and after adjustment.
The system should provide real-time feedback during manual adjustments to ensure that the operators can accurately understand the actual position of the flap angle.

requirement: The system should be able to receive and process data provided by the flight phase identification module to determine the current flight phase.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the integrity and authenticity of the data provided by the flight phase identification module, ensuring that the data has not been tampered with or damaged.
The system should perform real-time processing upon receiving data from the flight phase identification module and adjust its behavior according to the current flight phase to ensure Safety.
The system should have an abnormal data detection mechanism that can trigger corresponding Safety response measures when receiving abnormal or invalid data.

requirement: The system should be able to select the appropriate flap deflection position based on the current phase of flight.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the matching of flight phases with flap angle positions to ensure that the selected flap angle positions meet the Safety requirements for the current flight phase.
The system should monitor the changes in flap angle position in real time and immediately take corrective actions when anomalies are detected.
The system should record the adjustment history of the flap deflection angle position for traceability and analysis in case of a fault.

requirement: The system should be able to record and display the current deflection angle position of the flaps.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accuracy and integrity of the recorded flap angle positions, preventing data from being tampered with or lost.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of the flap angle position display to ensure that the displayed value matches the actual position, and trigger an alarm when there is an abnormal display.
The system should restrict access to the flap angle position records, ensuring that only authorized personnel can view and modify the records.

requirement: Record the old values of the given attitude angles (roll, yaw, and pitch) before the switch, as the starting point for smoothing.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the old values of the recorded attitude angles are not tampered with or lost during the switching process.
The system should verify the integrity of the old values of the recorded attitude angles, ensuring that they remain consistent throughout the softening process.
The system should provide a backup mechanism to prevent the accidental loss of old attitude angle values during recording or switching.

requirement: The flaps are set to 0° during the ground waiting phase of the aircraft.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the flaps are automatically set to 0° during the aircraft's ground waiting phase and monitor the flap status in real time to prevent unauthorized adjustments. Safety is a crucial aspect of this functionality.
The system should be equipped with flap position sensors to verify that the flaps are accurately set to 0°, and trigger an alarm when a deviation is detected.
The system should log the operation of setting the flaps to 0°, ensuring traceability and non-repudiation of the operation.

requirement: When the aircraft begins takeoff, it starts from the ground roll phase, with the flaps deflected to 15°.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that during the deflection of the flaps to 15 degrees, it continuously monitors the flap position to prevent the deflection angle from exceeding the Safety range.
The system should detect abnormal conditions, such as mechanical failures or sensor failures, during the flap deflection process and trigger corresponding Safety mechanisms.
The system should verify that the aircraft's aerodynamic performance meets takeoff requirements after the flaps are deflected to 15 degrees, and issue a warning if the conditions are not met.

requirement: Timing starts when flying to climb segment 1, if the landing gear is retracted within 1 minute, then after a 5-second delay from the retraction time, the flaps are set to 0°.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure accurate timing starts when flying to the climb segment 1 and detect the retraction status of the landing gear within 1 minute.
The system should accurately delay for 5 seconds after the landing gear is retracted and ensure that the flaps are set to 0°.
The system should monitor the status of the landing gear and flaps in real time to ensure that the warning mechanism is triggered in case of abnormalities.
The system should record the times of landing gear retraction and flap retraction for post-event analysis and troubleshooting.

requirement: If the landing gear is still not retracted after 1 minute, then directly set the flaps to 0°.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the landing gear status in real time to ensure that it can accurately identify and trigger the flap retraction operation if the landing gear is not retracted after 1 minute.
The system should perform a validity check on the flap retraction operation to ensure that the flaps successfully retract to 0° and remain stable.
The system should continuously monitor the flight status during the execution of flap retraction operations to prevent flight instability or hazardous conditions caused by the operation.

requirement: When the aircraft flies to the fourth side of the five-side approach, if the distance to the point is less than 1500m, then set the flaps to 15 degrees.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the distance between the aircraft and the arrival point in real time, ensuring that the flaps are accurately deployed to 15° when the distance is less than 1500m.
The system should verify the correctness of the flap control commands to ensure that the flap angle is accurately set to 15°.
The system should promptly trigger an alarm and take corrective actions when there is an abnormal flap angle setting.
The system should ensure that flap operation does not affect the stability and Safety of the aircraft, and automatically recover to a safe state in the event of an abnormality.

requirement: When flying to the fifth side, lower the flaps to 40° when the distance from the predetermined landing point is less than Hw / tanλ + 1020 m and greater than Hw / tanλ + 20 m.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor in real-time the distance between the aircraft and the predetermined landing point, ensuring that the flap deployment operation of 40° is accurately executed when the distance is within the range of Hw / tgλ + 20 m to Hw / tgλ + 1020 m.
The system should verify environmental conditions before flap deployment operations to ensure the aircraft is in a Safety state, avoiding flap deployment under abnormal conditions.
The system should monitor the aircraft's attitude and status in real time after the flap operation, ensuring that the aircraft remains stable after the flaps are extended to 40°.

requirement: If the aircraft does not enter the glide slope window, it will level off again and retract the flaps to 15° (Vg will change accordingly).
safety_requirements: The system should monitor in real-time whether the aircraft enters the glide window, ensuring that altitude holding and flap retraction operations are accurately performed when not entering the glide window. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.
The system should monitor the changes in Vg in real time during the process of retracting the flaps to 15 degrees, ensuring it remains within the Safety range.
The system should verify the current state of the aircraft before performing the flap retraction operation to ensure that the operation will not cause abnormal flight conditions.
The system should confirm the status after completing the flap retraction operation to ensure that the flap position and Vg value meet the expected conditions.

requirement: If the aircraft enters the glide slope window, the flaps remain at 40° until full landing.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor in real-time whether the aircraft enters the glide window and ensure that the flap angle remains at 40° after entry.
The system should immediately trigger the corrective mechanism when the flap angle deviates from 40 degrees, ensuring that the flap angle returns to 40 degrees.
The system should ensure that the flap angle transitions safely from 40° to the post-landing state after full landing, and verify the Safety of the transition process.

requirement: During a normal approach for landing, the system deploys flaps to 15° at point A and to 40° at point B; during a reverse approach for landing, the system deploys flaps to 15° at point C and to 40° at point D.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the flap angle in real time when deploying flaps to ensure the accuracy of the flap angles at points A and B during a normal landing, and at points C and D during a reverse landing.

The system should have a mechanism to detect abnormal flap angles, and if the flap angle does not match the expected value, the system should immediately trigger an alarm and take appropriate actions.

The system should ensure that the deployment time and sequence of the flaps during both normal and reverse landings comply with Safety operation specifications, preventing flight risks caused by operational errors.

requirement: In remote control mode, when the system receives a "flap position 0" control command from the remote, it issues a flap 0° control signal; when it receives a "flap position 1" control command, it issues a flap 15° control signal; when it receives a "flap position 2" control command, it issues a flap 40° control signal.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the origin and integrity of remote control commands to ensure that the commands have not been tampered with or forged.
The system should immediately perform a validity check on the flap position control command upon receipt, ensuring that the command value is within the valid range.
The system should confirm that the current flight status allows for flap position adjustment before executing flap position control commands.

The system should monitor the actual position of the flaps in real time after issuing the flap control signal, ensuring it matches the commanded position, and take corrective actions if any deviation occurs.
The system should record all received flap position control commands and their execution results for subsequent audit and troubleshooting.

requirement: When switching between the remote control mode with and without the inner loop, record the old rudder deflection command before the switch as the softening starting point.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the integrity of the old rudder deflection command values before switching modes, preventing data from being tampered with or lost.
The system should verify the old rudder deflection command values recorded during mode switching to ensure their accuracy and consistency.
The system should monitor in real time the old rudder bias command values at the softening start point after the mode switch to ensure they comply with the Safety requirements of the current mode.

requirement: The retraction control of the landing gear is initiated by a retract signal and checked by a retracted lock signal to confirm if it has been retracted. The extension control of the landing gear is initiated by an extend signal and checked by an extended lock signal to confirm if it has been extended. If the extension is unsuccessful, an emergency extension signal can activate the emergency pump.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the Safety of transmission for both the retract and extend landing gear signals, preventing unauthorized signal tampering or interference.

The system should monitor the status of the retracted lock signal and the extended lock signal in real time to ensure the correct position of the landing gear, and trigger an alarm in case of abnormalities.

The system should immediately activate the emergency pump upon triggering of the emergency release signal and ensure the proper operation of the emergency pump to guarantee the safe lowering of the landing gear.
The system should encrypt all control signals to prevent interception or forgery.

requirement: The landing gear can be controlled for retraction and extension in autonomous control, manual correction, and remote control modes. In autonomous control or manual correction, the flight control system automatically retracts and extends the landing gear based on the aircraft's position, movement, and other information. In remote control mode, the ground control station can issue commands at any time to retract or extend the landing gear.
safety_requirements: The system must ensure the accuracy and timeliness of landing gear retraction and extension control in autonomous control, manual correction, and remote control modes, preventing misoperation or delayed operation.

The system should monitor and automatically adjust the landing gear status in real time based on the aircraft's position, movement, and other information when under autonomous control or manual correction to ensure Safety.
In remote control mode, the system should verify the legality and validity of commands issued by the ground control station to prevent the execution of unauthorized commands.

The system should have the function of landing gear status monitoring and anomaly detection to ensure that timely alarms are triggered and safety measures are taken when anomalies occur during the retraction and extension of the landing gear.

requirement: When the aircraft takes off and reaches climb phase 1 with the landing gear down, the system should set the landing gear retraction signal to high level and simultaneously send left and right brake signals (brake pressure at 50% FS).
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the aircraft status in real time to ensure that when the takeoff reaches the climb phase 1 and the landing gear is in the down position, it accurately triggers the landing gear retraction signal to be high level.

The system should ensure that when the signal to retract the landing gear is issued, the pressure values of the left and right brake signals are accurately set to 50% FS, and it should monitor the brake pressure in real time to ensure it meets the requirements.
The system should immediately trigger a fault warning mechanism and take corresponding Safety measures when it detects abnormalities in the landing gear status or brake signals.

requirement: 1 second after, the system should check the retraction lock signal. If the retraction lock signal is low, then continue to check the landing gear retraction status.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure accurate detection of the level state of the retracted lock signal after 1 second, and continue to check the landing gear retraction status under low-level conditions.
The system should perform real-time validation of the detected retraction lock signal to ensure the Safety and accuracy of the signal, preventing misjudgment.
The system should immediately trigger safety mechanisms when it detects an abnormal signal for retraction and locking, ensuring the safety of the landing gear's retraction and extension status.

requirement: If the landing gear is in the down position, the system should set the retract landing gear signal to low level, set the left and right brake signals to 0, and set the landing gear retraction fault flag.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the landing gear status in real time to ensure that when the landing gear is in the down position, the signal to retract the landing gear is correctly set to a low level.
The system should set the left and right brake signals to 0 when the landing gear is in the down position to prevent brake failure caused by misoperation.
The system should immediately set the landing gear retraction failure flag and trigger the corresponding fault handling mechanism when it detects a landing gear retraction failure.
The system should ensure that the updating of related signals and the setting of fault flags are accurate when the landing gear status changes.

requirement: If the landing gear is in the retracted position, the system should set the gear retraction signal to low level and the left and right brake signals to 0.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the landing gear status in real time to ensure that when the landing gear is retracted, the retract signal is accurately set to a low level.
The system should verify that the left and right brake signals are correctly set to 0 when the landing gear is retracted, and trigger an alarm if the signals are abnormal.
The system should have a redundancy mechanism to ensure that the landing gear signals can still be correctly set in case of sensor failure or abnormal signal transmission.

requirement: If the retracted lock signal is high, the system should periodically check the retracted lock signal.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the detection frequency of the retracted lock signal meets real-time requirements, avoiding Safety hazards caused by detection delays.
The system should immediately take corresponding Safety measures when it detects a high-level signal for retracted lock, preventing the system from entering an unsafe state.
The system should record the detection results of the retracted lock signal and ensure the integrity and traceability of the logs for subsequent analysis and auditing.

requirement: If the retraction lock signal goes low within 1 minute, the system should set the retraction landing gear signal to low, set the left and right brake signals to 0, and set the landing gear status to retracted.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the retraction lock signal in real time and, upon detecting a low level within 1 minute, immediately set the retraction landing gear signal to low level, set the left and right brake signals to 0, and update the landing gear status to retracted.
The system should verify the continuous low-level state of the retraction lock signal before performing the landing gear retraction operation to ensure the accuracy of the operation.
The system should check for updates on the landing gear status after performing the retraction operation, ensuring that the status matches the actual operation. Safety is a priority in this process.
The system should trigger a warning mechanism and record the abnormal information when it detects an abnormal signal for retraction and locking.

requirement: If the lock signal remains high 1 minute after retraction, the system should set the landing gear retraction signal to low level, set the left and right brake signals to 0, and set the landing gear retraction failure flag.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the status of the retraction lock signal in real time, ensuring that after 1 minute if the signal remains high, it can promptly set the retraction landing gear signal to low level and the left and right brake signals to 0.
The system should set the landing gear retraction failure flag and trigger the fault alarm mechanism one minute after detecting a continuous high-level signal for retraction lock.
The system should ensure that after setting the landing gear retraction failure flag, related operations are stopped to prevent further Safety hazards.

requirement: When the aircraft returns and flies to the third side of the five-side approach, and the distance to the arrival point is less than 5000m, the system should set the left and right brakes to 100%, and set the landing gear deployment signal to high level.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the distance between the aircraft and the target point in real time, ensuring that when the distance is less than 5000m, it accurately triggers the operation to set the left and right brakes to 100% and the landing gear signal to a high level.

The system should perform a consistency check on the status of the left and right brake and landing gear signals to ensure that, when the triggering conditions are met, the relevant operations are correctly executed.

The system should perform Safety verification before executing braking and landing gear operations, ensuring that the current state of the aircraft is suitable for these operations, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of abnormalities.

requirement: Flight control and management software needs to achieve electrical equipment management
safety_requirements: Flight control and management software should ensure access control for the management functions of electrical equipment to prevent unauthorized operations.
The system should monitor the status of electrical equipment in real time and immediately take Safety measures when abnormalities are detected.
The electrical equipment management function should have data integrity protection to ensure the accuracy and consistency of device configuration and status information.
The system should log all operations of electrical equipment management for audit and traceability in case of a Safety incident.

requirement: When switching between the remote control mode with an inner loop, record the old values of the given attitude angles (roll, yaw, and pitch) before the switch as the softening starting point.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the integrity and accuracy of the old attitude angle values during mode switching, preventing data loss or tampering.

The system should verify whether the old values of the recorded attitude angles are consistent with the actual values before the switch, and trigger an error handling mechanism if they are inconsistent.
The system should protect the confidentiality of the old values of the recorded attitude angles, preventing unauthorized access or disclosure.

requirement: 1 second after, the system should check the down lock signal.
safety_requirements: The system should accurately detect the lock-down signal 1 second later, ensuring the Safety and integrity of the signal.
The system should immediately trigger Safety mechanisms when it detects an abnormal drop lock signal, preventing unauthorized operations.
The system should log the process of detecting the lockout signal to ensure traceability of the event.

requirement: If the landing gear down lock signal is low, it indicates a failure in the landing gear down circuit. Setting the emergency landing gear down signal to high for 1 minute, then setting both the landing gear down and emergency landing gear down signals to low (this situation cannot check the down lock signal), and setting the left and right brakes to the corresponding preset amounts, the landing gear down fault flag is set to valid.
safety_requirements: The system should detect the level state of the down lock signal and promptly set the emergency gear deployment signal to high level when a low level is detected.

The system should ensure that, after the emergency landing gear deployment signal is set to high, both the landing gear deployment and the emergency landing gear deployment signals are set to low after 1 minute.
The system should automatically set the left and right brakes to the corresponding preset amounts and set the landing gear down fault flag to valid if it cannot check the lock-down signal.
The system should trigger the corresponding fault handling mechanism after the landing gear release fault flag is set to valid, and ensure Safety during flight.

requirement: If the landing gear down lock signal is high, periodically check the down lock signal: if the down lock signal goes low within 1 minute, it indicates that the landing gear has been deployed. Set the landing gear down signal to low, set the landing gear status to down, and set the left and right brakes to the corresponding preset amounts. Invalidate the landing gear deployment failure flag.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor in real-time the level state of the lock signal to ensure that when the signal becomes low, the landing gear status and brake preset values are accurately updated.
The system should immediately set the landing gear deployment signal to low level and update the landing gear status to deployed after the lock release signal goes low.
The system should ensure that the left and right brakes are set to the corresponding preset values and clear the landing gear down fault flag after detecting a change in the lock-down signal.
The system should have a fault detection mechanism to ensure that if no change in the drop lock signal is detected within 1 minute, it can trigger the fault handling process.

requirement: If the landing gear down lock signal is high, then periodically check the down lock signal: if it remains high after 1 minute, it indicates a landing gear deployment failure, and the emergency landing gear down signal is set to high. After 1 second, periodically check the down lock signal again.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor in real-time the voltage level of the lock-down signal to ensure that the inspection mechanism is immediately initiated when the signal is high.

The system should automatically trigger the emergency landing gear deployment signal and set this signal to high level after detecting that the lock release signal has been continuously high for 1 minute.
The system should continue to periodically check the down lock signal after triggering the emergency gear deployment signal, ensuring continuous monitoring of the system's fault status.
The system should have the function to promptly notify the operator and record the fault information when a landing gear deployment failure is detected.

requirement: If the lock signal remains high after 1 minute, it indicates that the emergency landing gear deployment has failed. Set both the landing gear deployment and emergency landing gear deployment signals to low, and set the left and right brakes to the corresponding preset amounts. The landing gear deployment failure flag is set to valid.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the status of the lock signal in real time to ensure that if the lock signal remains high after 1 minute, it can accurately execute the response operation for a failed emergency release of the landing gear.

The system, upon detecting a failure in the emergency landing gear deployment, should immediately set the landing gear deployment and emergency deployment signals to low level, and ensure that the left and right brakes are set to the preset amount to prevent safety risks caused by landing gear failures.
The system should trigger the corresponding fault alarm mechanism after the landing gear release fault flag is set to valid, to alert the operators to handle it promptly.
The system should record the state changes of the signals for lowering the landing gear and emergency lowering of the landing gear for subsequent fault analysis and handling.

requirement: If the lock signal drops to a low level within 1 minute, it indicates that the emergency release of the landing gear was successful. After a 2-second delay, the signals for releasing the landing gear and emergency releasing the landing gear are both set to a low level, the landing gear status is set to down, and the left and right brakes are set to the corresponding preset amounts. The landing gear release failure flag is set to invalid.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the status changes of the landing gear emergency release signal in real time, ensuring that when the lock signal drops to a low level within 1 minute, it accurately identifies the successful emergency release of the landing gear.

After the system confirms the successful emergency deployment of the landing gear, it should strictly adhere to the 2-second delay requirement and set the signals for lowering the landing gear and emergency lowering of the landing gear to a low level to ensure the accuracy of the operation timing.

The system should accurately update the landing gear status to deployed and ensure that the preset amounts for both left and right brakes are set correctly, avoiding Safety hazards caused by incorrect status updates or improper brake presets.

The system should promptly invalidate the landing gear deployment failure flag after a successful emergency lowering of the landing gear, ensuring the accuracy of the failure flag and avoiding incorrect or missed fault reports.

requirement: When powering up on the ground, the system should initialize all signals and states to ensure the initial state of the landing gear and brake systems is correct.
safety_requirements: The system should perform an integrity check on all signals and states at power-on to ensure their initial status is correct and error-free.

The system should monitor the initialization process of the landing gear and brake systems to ensure that no abnormalities occur during power-up, and trigger safety mechanisms in case of abnormalities.
The system should log the initialization process and results at power-on for auditing and troubleshooting as needed.

requirement: Set the landing gear status to down.
safety_requirements: The system should verify that the flight altitude and speed are within the Safety operation range when setting the landing gear to the down position, and prohibit operation if the conditions are not met.

The system should monitor the landing gear status in real time to ensure that the landing gear is correctly locked after the lowering operation is executed, and trigger an alarm if it is not locked. Safety is a priority in this process.
The system should record the time of landing gear status changes, the operator, and current flight parameters for post-event analysis and auditing.

requirement: Remote control commands to deploy or retract the landing gear can be issued in any control mode as required.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that before issuing remote control commands, it verifies the legality and Safety of the current control mode.

The system should implement permission verification to ensure that only authorized personnel can issue remote control commands for the landing gear. Safety is a critical consideration in this process.
The system should monitor the landing gear status in real time to ensure that remote control commands are blocked in case of abnormalities.
The system should log all remote control commands issued and executed to facilitate subsequent audits and troubleshooting.

requirement: When a "retract landing gear" remote control command is received, if the flight phase is not ground waiting and the flight altitude is not less than 80m, then proceed according to item 1) in section 3.2.11.3 (excluding its conditions).
safety_requirements: The system should verify the validity of the "retract landing gear" command, ensuring it originates from an authorized remote source.
The system should confirm that the current flight phase is not ground waiting and the flight altitude is no less than 80m before executing the "retract landing gear" command.

The system should monitor the landing gear status in real time after executing the "retract landing gear" command, ensuring it is correctly retracted and triggering an alarm in case of abnormalities. Safety is a priority.
The system should record the execution of the "retract landing gear" command, including the time, flight status, and altitude information, for post-event auditing.

requirement: When switching between the inner-loop remote control mode with and without, record the old value of the rudder deflection command before the switch as the softening starting point.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the integrity of the old rudder deflection command values before mode switching when transitioning, preventing data from being tampered with or lost.
The system should verify the accuracy of the old rudder deflection command value before the record switch, ensuring it is consistent with the actual rudder deflection command.
The system should monitor the legality of switching operations during mode transitions to prevent unauthorized mode changes.

requirement: When a remote command to "lower the landing gear" is received, proceed as per 2) in 3.2.11.3 (excluding its conditions).
safety_requirements: The system should verify the legitimacy and integrity of the source when it receives a remote control command to 'lower the landing gear', ensuring that the command has not been tampered with or forged.

The system should monitor the landing gear status in real time when executing the 'lower landing gear' command, ensuring it operates correctly according to the预定流程 and conditions, and immediately stop the operation and trigger an alarm in case of abnormalities.
The system should record the execution process and outcome of the 'lower landing gear' command for subsequent auditing and troubleshooting.

requirement: The aircraft has two independent braking systems, one for each of the rear wheels, and the brakes use a PWM control scheme. The flight control computer sends a 2kHz pulse width modulation signal to the braking system, where the braking torque is proportional to the duty cycle of the pulse width modulation signal. The braking duration corresponds to the duration of the PWM signal.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the independence of the two rear wheel braking systems to avoid brake failure caused by a single point of failure.
The system should perform real-time monitoring of the PWM signals sent by the flight control computer to ensure the accuracy of the signal frequency and duty cycle.
The system should check the consistency between the braking torque and the PWM signal duty cycle, and trigger a fault alarm when there is inconsistency.
The system should monitor the brake duration to ensure it is consistent with the PWM signal duration and take safety measures in case of abnormalities.

requirement: Before takeoff, the braking torque of both wheels is set to the maximum value simultaneously to prevent the aircraft from sliding. This is known as static braking.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the braking torque of both wheels reaches the maximum value before takeoff and monitor the braking torque status in real time through sensors to prevent the aircraft from sliding.

The system should have a fault detection function that can immediately trigger an alarm and take appropriate measures when the braking torque does not reach its maximum value or when an anomaly occurs.
The system should record the operating status of the braking torque and sensor data to ensure integrity and traceability during the static braking phase.

requirement: During the ground run, differential braking is applied by generating a larger braking torque on one main wheel and a smaller braking torque on the other based on the aircraft's lateral deviation from the runway centerline to correct the deviation.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor in real-time the lateral deviation of the aircraft from the runway center, ensuring accurate torque distribution of the differential braking to prevent the aircraft from deviating from the runway due to incorrect torque allocation.

The system should perform real-time validation of the differential brake execution to ensure that the adjustment of braking torque matches the correction of lateral offset, and trigger an alarm in case of abnormalities.
The system should record the operation history of the differential braking, including lateral offset, brake torque distribution, and correction effectiveness, for post-event analysis and auditing.

requirement: After the landing rollout speed decreases to a certain value, to reduce the rollout distance, the same braking torque is applied simultaneously to both main wheels. This is called dynamic braking.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the braking torque applied to both main wheels is exactly the same to avoid deviation in the taxiing direction due to uneven torque.
The system should monitor the application of braking torque in real time and immediately stop the braking operation when an abnormality is detected.
The system should continuously monitor the skidding speed during dynamic braking to ensure that the application of braking torque is synchronized with the speed reduction process.
The system should have a fault detection function, capable of promptly issuing an alarm and taking emergency measures when a fault occurs in the braking system.

requirement: This function controls the brake system based on the flight phase of the aircraft.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the control logic of the braking system matches the current flight phase as the aircraft goes through different flight stages.
The system should perform real-time validation of control commands for the braking system to ensure the correctness and timeliness of the commands.
The system should perform fault detection during the braking system control process and take Safety measures when a fault is detected.
The system should log the control operations of the braking system for post-event audits and fault analysis.

requirement: If the landing gear fully compressed signal is valid and the airspeed is less than a certain speed threshold vk_may_brake, differential braking is used to correct the deviation.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the authenticity and validity of the landing gear full compression signal, ensuring that the signal has not been tampered with or falsely reported.
The system should monitor airspeed in real time and ensure the correct execution of the differential braking function for correction when the airspeed is less than the speed threshold vk_may_brake.
The system should perform real-time monitoring during differential braking correction to ensure the reasonable distribution of braking force and prevent over-correction or under-correction.
The system should trigger a safety warning mechanism and take appropriate emergency measures when it detects a signal of full compression of the landing gear or abnormal airspeed.

requirement: In autonomous control mode, the differential brake control law is: δb = -(Kz * Dz + Kz * Dz - K * Δy - Ky * wy)
safety_requirements: The system should verify the validity of the differential brake control law input parameters to ensure that the parameters are within a reasonable range.
The system should perform real-time monitoring of the output δb of the differential brake control law, and initiate Safety protection mechanisms when abnormal values are detected.
The system should ensure that the calculation process of the differential brake control law in autonomous control mode is not affected by external interference or tampering.
The system should record the calculation results of the differential brake control law and operation logs for post-event analysis and auditing.

requirement: In the manual correction mode, the differential brake control law is: δb = -[Kz * (Dz - DzgSemi - DzsemiOld) + Kz * Dz - K * Δy - Ky * wy], where DzsemiOld is the lateral deviation correction amount during the flare phase.
safety_requirements: The system should verify that the parameters Kz, K, and Ky in the differential brake control law are within the preset range to ensure the accuracy of the control law calculation.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of the output δb of the differential brake control law to ensure it remains within the Safety range, and trigger a correction mechanism when it exceeds this range.

The system should log and verify the values of DzsemiOld to ensure that the correction amount in the flattening segment meets expectations, preventing control deviations caused by historical data errors.

requirement: In the in-band loop remote control (attitude remote control) mode, the differential brake control law is: δb = K * (-yg) + Ky * wy
safety_requirements: The system should verify the calculation results of the differential brake control law δb to ensure its consistency with the input parameters yg and wy, and trigger a correction mechanism in case of calculation errors.
The system should perform real-time monitoring of the output of the differential brake control law δb to ensure its stability and Safety in the inner-loop remote control mode.
The system should record the calculation process of the differential brake control law δb to facilitate auditing and analysis in case of anomalies.

requirement: When there is a phase transition or a control mode switch related to the remote control mode, record the old value of the throttle bias command before the conversion as the softening starting point.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that during phase transitions or control mode switches, the old value of the throttle valve bias command is accurately recorded and subsequently used correctly as the starting point for softening in later operations.
The system should verify the integrity of the old values of the recorded throttle bias command to prevent data from being tampered with or lost during the recording process.

The system should monitor in real time after recording the old values of the throttle valve bias command, ensuring that it matches the current control status, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of abnormalities.

requirement: In the remote control mode without an inner loop (surface remote control), the specific formula for differential brake control law is not provided, but the corresponding control logic needs to be implemented.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the differential brake control logic is executed based on reliable sensor data and flight status, avoiding control failure due to incorrect data. Safety is a critical consideration in this process.
The system should have the capability to monitor in real-time the execution of differential braking control logic, and immediately take corrective actions when anomalies are detected.
The system should verify the conformity of the output of the differential brake control logic with the expected behavior, ensuring Safety during operation in the no inner-loop remote control mode.
The system should record the execution process and results of the differential brake control logic for post-event analysis and troubleshooting.

requirement: During the ground waiting phase, the differential brake control law in both autonomous and manual correction modes is: δb = 0.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that during the ground waiting phase, the differential brake control law δb is strictly maintained at 0, preventing any unauthorized modifications.
The system should monitor the value of the differential brake control law δb in real time, and immediately trigger an alarm and take corrective actions when a non-zero value is detected.
The system should verify the accuracy of the differential brake control law δb in both autonomous and manual correction modes, ensuring consistency in both modes.

requirement: In remote control mode, it is the same as the taxiing phase, where vk_may_brake = 80km/h.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that in remote control mode, when the speed reaches or exceeds 80km/h, the braking function can be correctly activated.
The system should monitor the value of vk_may_brake in real time and automatically activate the braking system when it reaches 80km/h, ensuring Safety during the rollout phase.
The system should continuously monitor the braking effect after the brake function is triggered and adjust the braking force as necessary to ensure a safe stop.

requirement: If the landing gear fully compressed signal is valid, and the airspeed is not less than vk_may_brake, then δb = 0.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the landing gear full compression signal and airspeed in real time to ensure that the value of δb is 0 when the airspeed is not less than vk_may_brake.
The system should validate the effectiveness of the landing gear full compression signal to prevent incorrect signals from causing a misjudgment of δb.

The system should immediately update the value of δb to 0 when it detects that the airspeed is not less than vk_may_brake and the signal for full compression of the landing gear is valid, and ensure that this value remains unchanged during the validity of the signal.

requirement: The δb amplitude is limited to [-XfB, XfB]. XfB is the maximum proportional braking amount, which can be set remotely, with a default value of 40%.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the value of δb always remains within the range [ -XfB, XfB ], and immediately apply amplitude limiting if it exceeds this range.
The system should perform authentication and authorization checks for remote settings of XfB, ensuring that only authorized users can make configurations.
The system should log the modification operations of XfB to ensure the non-repudiation of the operations.
The system should trigger an alarm when XfB exceeds the preset range and take 40% as a default value as a temporary measure.

requirement: The differential braking method used for bias correction is the differential proportional braking (referred to as proportional braking).
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the control signals for proportional braking are not tampered with during transmission, maintaining the integrity of the data.

The system should monitor the execution effect of proportional braking in real time to ensure it aligns with the expected correction effect, and promptly alarm when the deviation exceeds the allowed range.
The system should have a fault detection function that can automatically switch to the backup correction method when a fault occurs in the proportional braking system.
