The system should ensure that when δb >= 0, the calculated values of δbL and δbR are accurate and consistent with the preset conditions.
The system should monitor the input values of δb, YzBL, YzBR, and YjB in real time to ensure they are within a reasonable range, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of abnormalities.
The system should perform a consistency check on the calculated δbL and δbR to ensure they comply with logical and flight status requirements.

requirement: YzBL and YzBR are the preset values for left and right brakes, respectively, which can be set through remote control. The default value is 10%.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the configuration process of YzBL and YzBR has authentication and authorization mechanisms to prevent unauthorized modifications.
The system should monitor the values of YzBL and YzBR in real time to ensure they remain within the preset Safety range, and trigger an alarm when they exceed this range.
The system should record all modifications to YzBL and YzBR, ensuring the traceability and non-repudiation of operations.
The system should provide clear warning messages when the default values of YzBL and YzBR are modified, and perform a second confirmation if necessary.

requirement: YjB is the emergency brake bias, normally 0, and 30% in case of link interruption.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the link status in real time to ensure that YjB is automatically set to 30% when the link is interrupted.
The system should have the capability to detect abnormal link states and immediately adjust YjB to the specified value when an anomaly is detected.
The system should regularly verify the correctness of the YjB value, ensuring it is 0 under normal conditions and 30% when the link is interrupted.

safety_requirements: The system should ensure that max(δbL, δbR) ≤1 during the calculation process, and immediately stop the calculation and trigger an alarm if it exceeds the range.

The system should perform real-time validation of the calculation results to ensure that max(δbL, δbR) always meets the ≤1 condition, and log records and warnings should be issued in case of anomalies.

The system should have a redundant check mechanism to ensure the accuracy of max(δbL, δbR) during the calculation process, and it should perform automatic correction or manual intervention when an anomaly is detected.

requirement: Autonomous control functions must have flight control capabilities.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the integrity and confidentiality of data in the generation and transmission of flight control commands.
The system should have the capability of real-time monitoring of flight status and automatically switch to backup control mode when anomalies are detected.
The system should verify the validity of flight control commands to prevent the execution of unauthorized commands.
The system should record all flight control operations for subsequent audit and analysis.

requirement: The specific softening time should be determined based on control requirements, actual needs, and previous control experience.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the softening time settings, based on control requirements and actual needs, do not lead to loss of control or response delays.
The system should regularly review and verify the settings of the softening time to ensure they comply with previous control experiences and adapt to the current operating environment.
The system should automatically adjust or trigger an alarm when there is an abnormality in the softening time setting, to prevent potential Safety risks.

requirement: During the phase transition, it is necessary to initialize the integrator in the control law of the new phase to ensure proper control of the aircraft to achieve the预定的 control effect.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the correctness and completeness of the integrator initialization process during phase transitions to ensure the effectiveness of the control laws.

The system should monitor the control effectiveness after the integrator initialization to ensure that the aircraft behavior is consistent with the预定 control objectives, and take corrective actions when deviations are detected.
The system should record the detailed process of integrator initialization so that it can be traced back and analyzed in case of control abnormalities.

requirement: Phase transition processing in non-remote control mode is carried out in stages under autonomous control, manual correction, and command control modes as follows.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the continuity and stability of the flight status during transitions between autonomous control, manual correction, and command control modes.
The system should perform authorization verification during mode transitions to ensure that only authorized users can perform mode switching operations.
The system should log all mode conversion operations for audit and troubleshooting purposes.
The system should monitor the flight status parameters in real time during mode transitions to ensure that no abnormalities occur during the transition process.

requirement: The entry and exit of the ground holding phase are controlled by a two-out-of-three switch command to enhance reliability.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that when receiving switch commands, it uses a two-out-of-three logic for verification to prevent misoperation caused by single-point failures. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.
The system should perform a status consistency check when transitioning into and out of the ground hold phase to ensure synchronization between command execution and system status.
The system should log the execution of all switch commands and trigger an alarm mechanism in case of abnormalities.

requirement: The conversion conditions for other stages should be judged multiple times according to specific situations. The stage transition only occurs when the results of five consecutive judgments are consistent, in order to reduce the probability of misjudgment.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the logic for judging phase transition conditions is correct, and it should perform a phase transition when there are five consecutive consistent judgment results.
The system should record the result of each judgment to facilitate traceability and analysis in case of misjudgment.
The system should perform a final verification before phase transition to ensure the Safety of the transition conditions.

requirement: After the flight control computer is powered on the ground or after the aircraft has fully landed and issued a pre-shutdown command for the flight control system, it enters the ground waiting phase.
safety_requirements: After receiving the pre-shutdown command from the flight controller, the system should ensure that all critical function modules are safely shut down to prevent data loss or system damage.
The system should continuously monitor the power status during the ground waiting phase to ensure stable power supply and prevent unexpected power outages.
The system should maintain necessary communication functions while waiting on the ground so that it can receive and execute instructions in emergencies.

requirement: During the ground roll (including takeoff and landing roll) phase, after receiving a ground hold command from remote control, it transitions into the ground hold phase.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the legality of remote control commands, ensuring that the command source is trustworthy and has not been tampered with.
The system, upon receiving the ground hold instruction, should immediately switch states to ensure a smooth transition from the ground roll phase to the ground hold phase.
The system should monitor the status during the ground waiting phase, ensuring that the current status is maintained before receiving new instructions, preventing unauthorized status changes.
The system should log all received remote control commands and their execution status for subsequent auditing and troubleshooting.

requirement: When max(δbL, δbR) > 100%, if δbL ≥ δbR, then set δbR = δbR - (δbL - 100), δbL = 100%; if δbR > δbL, then set δbL = δbL - (δbR - 100), δbR = 100%. This ensures that the left and right brakes meet the differential requirements.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the values of δbL and δbR in real time to ensure that when max(δbL, δbR) > 100%, the values of δbL and δbR are promptly adjusted to meet the differential requirements.
The system should perform a consistency check on the adjusted δbL and δbR to ensure their values do not exceed 100%, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should log each adjustment of δbL and δbR for subsequent audit and analysis.

requirement: The braking command issued remotely has the highest priority. Regardless of the control mode, when a "brake" command is received, the aircraft will apply full braking force to both left and right brake controls, then process any over-limit conditions. This full braking force can be set remotely, with a default value of 80%.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the 'brake' command is immediately recognized and executed in any control mode, and its priority cannot be overridden by other commands. Safety is a critical concern in this context.
The system should validate the received 'brake' command to ensure its source is legitimate and it has not been tampered with.

The system should monitor in real-time the叠加 process of brake control to ensure that the full brake amount is correctly applied and handle over-limit conditions, preventing the brake amount from exceeding the Safety range.
The system should record the execution of all 'brake' commands, including the source of the command, the execution time, and the brake amount, for subsequent audit and analysis.

The system should have an exception handling mechanism to take timely Safety measures, such as switching to a backup braking system or triggering emergency braking, if a fault occurs during the execution of a braking command.

requirement: When the "release brakes" command is received, the braking is performed according to the calculated left and right brake amounts (i.e., no longer adding the full brake amount). At this time, if the calculated brake amount δb is 0, then both the left and right brakes are set to the corresponding preset brake amounts.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the accuracy of the calculated brake amount δb after receiving the 'release brake' command, ensuring it conforms to the current brake status.
The system should automatically apply the preset amounts of left and right braking when the brake quantity δb is 0, and ensure the accuracy and consistency of the preset amounts.
The system should monitor brake operations in real time to ensure that no unauthorized adjustments to the brake amount occur during the execution of the 'release brake' command.
The system should immediately trigger a warning mechanism and take corresponding Safety measures when there is an abnormality in the braking operation.

requirement: The flight control system generates necessary commands in real time based on the collected input information related to the aircraft, according to relevant regulations or mathematical models, to control the relevant equipment and ensure the aircraft flies in the required manner.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the integrity and accuracy of the collected aircraft input information, preventing data tampering or loss.
The system should perform real-time verification of the generated control instructions to ensure they comply with the requirements of regulations or mathematical models.
The system should have fault detection and tolerance mechanisms, and be able to respond promptly and take Safety measures when there are abnormalities in input information or control commands.
The system should log all control commands and input information for traceability and analysis in case of a Safety incident.
The system should ensure the Safety of the transmission and execution process of control commands, preventing unauthorized access or interference.

requirement: When receiving a driving command or a release brake command, the braking control amounts for the left and right brakes are respectively set to the left and right ground inspection braking amounts.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the brake control amounts on the left and right sides match the detected brake amounts on the left and right sides when it receives a driving instruction or a brake release instruction, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of abnormalities.
The system should perform real-time monitoring of the left and right brake control amounts to ensure they match the ground inspection brake amount, and immediately correct any deviations found.
The system should record the execution of each braking command so that it can be traced and analyzed in case of Safety issues.

requirement: When the pre-shutdown command from the flight controller is received, set the brake control amounts for both left and right brakes to 0, which means clearing the preset amounts for both left and right brakes.
safety_requirements: The system should immediately verify whether the control quantities of the left and right brakes have been successfully cleared and record the status of the clearance operation after receiving the pre-shutdown command from the flight controller.
The system should ensure that the process of clearing the left and right brake pre-settings does not affect the normal operation of other critical flight control functions.

After clearing the preset amounts for both the left and right brakes, the system should perform a self-check to confirm that the brake system has entered a Safety state and send a confirmation message to the operator if necessary.

requirement: Brake command processing only occurs during ground waiting, takeoff roll, and landing roll segments.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that brake commands are only processed during specific flight phases (ground waiting, takeoff roll, landing roll), and should automatically ignore or reject brake commands during other phases.

The system should monitor the flight phase status in real time to ensure that the braking commands match the current flight phase, and trigger an alarm or error handling mechanism when there is a mismatch.
The system should perform authentication and authorization checks on braking commands to ensure that only commands from legitimate sources are processed.

requirement: When retracting the landing gear, set both left and right brake amounts to 50%; when deploying the landing gear, set both left and right brake amounts to 100%; at the end of retracting the landing gear, set both left and right brake amounts to 0%; at the end of deploying the landing gear, set both left and right brake amounts to the preset value.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the left and right brake settings are accurately set during the process of retracting and deploying the landing gear, and are correctly reset to 0% or the preset amount at the end of the operation.
The system should monitor the changes in braking force in real time, ensuring its consistency with the landing gear status, and immediately trigger the Safety mechanism in case of abnormalities.
The system should record the time, status, and operator for each adjustment of the braking amount to ensure the traceability and non-repudiation of operations.

requirement: If an aircraft continues to land when the conditions for a safe landing are not met, it may affect the Safety of the landing. To improve the Safety of aircraft landing, a go-around function is provided, allowing the aircraft to adjust its flight status and attempt to land again.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor landing conditions in real time to ensure that the go-around function is automatically triggered when safe landing conditions are not met.
The system should continuously monitor the flight status during the go-around process to ensure the aircraft can safely adjust and re-enter the landing procedure.
The system should provide clear instructions and auxiliary information to the pilots after the go-around function is triggered to ensure the correctness of the operation.
The system should record all relevant data of go-around events for subsequent analysis and improvement of Safety measures.

requirement: After the aircraft enters the glide phase in either autonomous or manual correction mode, if it switches to remote control operation, and when the flight altitude is above the decision height (40m), if it switches back to autonomous control mode again, the aircraft will automatically go into a go-around, and it will adopt a softened transition method from remote control to autonomy.
safety_requirements: When the system switches to remote control mode, it should continuously monitor the flight altitude to ensure that when the flight altitude is above the decision altitude (40m), it can correctly identify and execute the operation to switch to autonomous control mode.

When the system transitions to autonomous control mode, it should ensure the execution of automatic go-around operations and adopt a softened transition from remote control to autonomy to avoid sudden changes in flight status.

The system should perform real-time status checks during mode switching to ensure the continuity and stability of the flight control system, preventing flight anomalies caused by the transfer of control authority.
The system should log all mode switching operations and provide an audit function for tracing analysis in case of anomalies.

requirement: The method of softening by setting the initial value of the integrator is adopted.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the process of setting the initial values of the integrator is safe and reliable, preventing unauthorized modifications or errors.
The system should verify the initial value settings of the integrator to ensure that they are within a reasonable range, avoiding system abnormalities caused by improper initial value settings.
The system should record the operation of setting the initial value of the integrator so that it can be traced and analyzed if problems occur.

requirement:
When the following conditions 1) and 2) are met simultaneously, execute the command to go around:
1) The flight altitude is higher than the decision height (40m). If the control mode is not remote, it should also have entered the glide path.
2) Receive the flight switch command: "go around".
safety_requirements: The system should verify whether it has entered the glide state when it detects that the flight altitude is higher than the decision altitude (40m) and the control mode is not remote, ensuring the accuracy of condition 1.
The system should verify the flight altitude and approach status upon receiving the 'go-around' command to ensure the correct execution of condition 2.
The system should perform multiple condition checks before executing the go-around command to ensure that both condition 1 and condition 2 are met, preventing incorrect operations.
The system should monitor the flight status in real time during the execution of the go-around command to ensure the Safety and accuracy of the command execution.

requirement: If the aircraft is in autonomous control mode, directly control the aircraft to perform a go-around. If the aircraft is not in autonomous control mode, automatically switch to autonomous control mode and then control the aircraft to perform a go-around. The softening method is the same as the softening method for mode transition.
safety_requirements: The system should perform a Safety validation of mode switching before the aircraft enters autonomous control mode, ensuring that the switching process does not cause abnormal fluctuations in the flight status.
The system should monitor the flight status in real time when controlling the aircraft to perform a go-around, ensuring the smoothness and Safety of the go-around operation.
The system should ensure consistency in the softening method during mode transitions to prevent flight control failure due to inconsistent transition methods.
The system should have an emergency handling mechanism under autonomous control mode to ensure Safety during go-around processes, allowing for timely responses to sudden situations.

requirement: Advance the throttle to 100% position, transition the flight phase to climb segment 2, longitudinally control the aircraft to climb to the final approach leg altitude, and laterally control the aircraft to intercept the final approach leg from the current point. After reaching the final approach altitude and leveling off, the aircraft will exit the go-around mode and set the flaps to 15°. It will then re-enter the final approach leg and land again.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that when the throttle is advanced to 100% position, the transition between flight phases is accurate and meets the requirements of climb phase 2.
The system should monitor the vertical control of the aircraft's climb process to ensure Safety during ascent to the final approach segment altitude.
The system should monitor the lateral control of the aircraft during the interception process to ensure that the aircraft accurately intercepts the final approach course from the current point.
The system should detect the status of the aircraft after it reaches the final approach height, ensuring that the altitude hold operation is accurately performed and safely exit the go-around state.
The system should control the flap setting to 15 degrees, ensuring the operation is accurate and meets Safety requirements.
The system should monitor the process of the aircraft re-entering the final approach and landing, ensuring the safety of the landing operation.

requirement: Control of the aircraft's movement is achieved through the deflection of control surfaces and adjustment of the engine's throttle.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the commands for control surface deflection and engine throttle adjustment are accurate and error-free, preventing flight loss of control due to misoperation.
The system should monitor the status of control surface deflection and engine throttle adjustments in real time, and immediately take corrective actions when anomalies are detected.
The system should have redundant control mechanisms to ensure that in the event of a failure in the primary control system, the backup system can take over and maintain aircraft motion control.
The system should regularly perform self-checks on the sensors and actuators for control surface deflection and engine throttle adjustment to ensure their normal operation.

requirement: During the go-around process, setting a starting point is not allowed, but changing the landing direction is permitted.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the function to set the starting point is disabled during the go-around process to prevent misoperation.
The system should allow for a change in landing direction during go-around and ensure the legitimacy and Safety of the direction change.
The system should monitor the operations during the go-around process in real time to ensure that all operations comply with flight Safety requirements.

requirement: Considering Safety, the issue of stall during flight cannot be ignored, and its judgment and handling require special attention.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor flight parameters in real time, detect signs of an impending stall, and issue timely warnings.
The system should have an automatic stall recovery function to ensure it can quickly return to normal flight status in a stall condition.
The system should record relevant data from stall events for subsequent analysis and improvement.

requirement: The input and output data tables for the stall control function requirements need to be clearly defined.
safety_requirements: The input and output data tables for the stall control function should have a completeness check mechanism to ensure that the data definitions are clear and not missing.

The input and output data tables for the stall control function should have data validation capabilities to ensure that the input data is within the valid range and the output data meets expectations.
The input and output data tables for the stall control function should record and monitor changes in data history to ensure data consistency and traceability.

requirement: The process for handling the requirements of stall control functionality needs to be defined in detail.
safety_requirements: The stall control function should ensure that the system can take timely corrective actions when a risk of stalling is detected, preventing the aircraft from entering a stall condition.
The system should monitor flight parameters in real time to ensure the trigger conditions and execution logic of the stall control function are accurate and error-free.

The stall control function should have a redundant mechanism to ensure that in the event of a failure in the main control system, the backup system can take over and continue to perform stall control.
The system should record the execution of the stall control function, including trigger times, execution results, etc., to facilitate post-event analysis and improvement.

requirement: In autonomous or manual correction control modes, if the aircraft is flying at a constant altitude or in the approach segment and the airspeed is determined to be less than a certain value (refer to the appendix for specific values) or the pitch angle is determined to be greater than 10 degrees for three consecutive judgments, the aircraft is considered to be in a stall condition.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accuracy of the detected airspeed and pitch angle data, and trigger a stall condition warning when there are three consecutive abnormal readings.
The system should automatically switch to a Safety control mode or prompt for manual intervention when a stall condition is detected.
The system should log the detection and response of stall conditions for post-event analysis and improvement.

requirement: Transition to climb segment 2, use elevator to control airspeed, advance throttles to 100%, if the aircraft stalls during approach segment 1, then enter go-around control.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the aircraft status in real time to ensure that when transitioning to climb segment 2, the elevator airspeed control is accurately executed and the throttle advancement to 100% is performed with Safety.
The system should detect if the aircraft stalls while entering the glide slope 1 and immediately enter go-around control upon detecting a stall, ensuring Safety.
The system should perform redundant verification of the elevator airspeed control to ensure that control accuracy can still be maintained in abnormal conditions.
The system should log and analyze the causes of stall events to optimize control strategies for subsequent flights, preventing similar events from recurring.

requirement: When the aircraft judges that the airspeed has increased to greater than the given speed for five consecutive times, it exits the stall condition. Depending on the altitude deviation at that time, it determines which phase to enter (either Climb Phase 2 or Constant Altitude Phase), and continues flying.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor airspeed data in real time to ensure the accuracy of five consecutive judgments, avoiding misjudgments that could cause the aircraft to incorrectly exit the stall condition.

The system should accurately calculate the altitude deviation after determining that the aircraft has exited the stall condition, ensuring the correct decision to transition into the second segment of climb or level flight.

The system should have an exception handling mechanism that can promptly trigger warnings and take safety measures when there are abnormalities in airspeed data or errors in altitude deviation calculations.
The system should record the decision-making process for exiting and entering the stall condition phases for subsequent analysis and auditing.

requirement: The aileron deflection commands calculated by the control law need to be allocated before being output to the actuators.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that rudder angle commands are subjected to rigorous validation and verification before being output to the actuator, ensuring the accuracy and integrity of the commands.

The system should monitor the allocation process of rudder deflection commands in real time, ensuring the correct distribution of aileron deflection commands, and immediately take corrective actions in case of abnormalities.
The system should record the process and results of the rudder deflection command allocation to facilitate traceability and analysis in case of a fault.

requirement: The efficiency of the aileron surface when deflected upwards is different from when it is deflected downwards; the upward deflection has lower efficiency, while the downward deflection has higher efficiency. By distributing the rudder deflection commands with different allocation coefficients, the aim is to achieve the same control effect.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accurate calculation of the rudder deflection command distribution coefficients to avoid imbalances in aileron control surface effects due to distribution errors.

The system should monitor the up and down deflection efficiency of the aileron surfaces in real time to ensure that the allocated rudder deflection commands are consistent with the expected control effects.
When abnormal control effectiveness of the aileron surfaces is detected, the system should immediately trigger the error correction mechanism to restore normal control effectiveness.

requirement: If the aileron deflection command δx > 0, then the left aileron deflection command δxL = k1 δx, and the right aileron deflection command δxR = k2
safety_requirements: The system should validate the aileron deflection angle command δx to ensure it is within a reasonable range.

The system should monitor in real-time the calculated results of the left aileron deflection command δxL and the right aileron deflection command δxR to ensure their consistency with the aileron deflection command δx.
The system should ensure the correct execution of the formulas for the left aileron deflection command δxL and the right aileron deflection command δxR when the aileron deflection command δx > 0.

The system should have an anomaly detection mechanism that triggers an alarm and takes appropriate measures when the calculation results of the left aileron deflection command δxL or the right aileron deflection command δxR are abnormal.

requirement: Autonomous flight control means that the aircraft autonomously completes all processes from takeoff, cruising, returning, and landing, including handling emergencies during flight.
safety_requirements: The system should have the capability of real-time monitoring of flight status to ensure safe operations during takeoff, cruising, returning, and landing phases.
The system should be able to automatically detect and handle emergencies during flight, ensuring Safety.
The system should implement multiple redundant control strategies to prevent single-point failures from causing system failure.
The system should have a self-diagnostic function, capable of detecting and reporting potential system failures during flight.
The system should ensure that all autonomous control decisions comply with predetermined Safety regulations and operational limits.

requirement: If the aileron deflection command δx < 0, then the left aileron deflection command δxL = k2 δx, and the right aileron deflection command δxR = k1 δx, where k1 is the upward deflection distribution coefficient, and k2 is the downward deflection distribution coefficient.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the input value of the aileron deflection command δx to ensure it falls within the preset range, preventing incorrect calculations caused by illegal inputs.

The system should check the values of the upward deflection distribution coefficient k1 and the downward deflection distribution coefficient k2 when calculating the left aileron deflection command δxL and the right aileron deflection command δxR, ensuring that they comply with Safety standards.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of the calculated left aileron deflection command δxL and right aileron deflection command δxR to ensure their consistency with the aileron deflection command δx, and trigger an alarm in case of abnormalities.
The system should record the calculation process of all aileron deflection commands so that it can be traced and analyzed in case of a failure.

requirement: The aileron deflection command distribution function of the flight control and management software must comply with qualification regulations and be verified through testing and review.
safety_requirements: The flight control and management software should ensure the correctness and consistency of the aileron deflection command distribution function, and its qualification should be verified through rigorous testing and review. Safety is a critical aspect of this process.
The system should monitor the execution status of the aileron deflection command distribution function in real time, and immediately trigger the Safety mechanism when an anomaly is detected.

The aileron deflection command distribution function should have a redundant design to ensure it can automatically switch to the backup function when the main function fails, maintaining flight Safety.

requirement: The flight control and management software should be able to calculate the stall speed based on the given flight weight, altitude, and flight true airspeed.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the validity of the input flight weight, altitude, and flight vacuum speed data to ensure that the data is within a reasonable range.
The system should monitor the calculated stall speed in real time to ensure it matches the current flight status, and trigger an alarm mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should regularly self-inspect the stall speed calculation module to ensure the correctness of its algorithms and logic, preventing incorrect calculations caused by software failures.

requirement: The flight control and management software should support stall speed calculations at different flap angles, especially the stall speed calculation when the flaps are at 40°.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the stall speed is accurately calculated at a flap angle of 40° and complies with flight Safety standards.

The system should perform real-time validation of the stall speed calculation results to ensure they match the current flight status and flap angles, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of abnormalities.
The system should have a data integrity protection mechanism to prevent the flap angle data from being tampered with or damaged during transmission or processing.

requirement: The ground hold phase transitions to the takeoff ground segment (takeoff roll segment) after the five-edge approach and airport pressure altitude are set, and a takeoff instruction is received.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the takeoff instructions are not received and processed until after the five-side approach and airport pressure altitude are set.
The system should verify the setup of the final approach course and airport pressure altitude before transitioning to the takeoff ground segment, ensuring its accuracy.

The system should monitor the source and validity of takeoff commands in real time when transitioning to the takeoff ground segment to prevent unauthorized commands from triggering a state transition.

The system should perform self-checks during state transitions to ensure that all relevant parameters and configurations meet the requirements for the takeoff ground segment, and in case of abnormalities, it should abort the transition and issue a warning.

requirement: During the takeoff run segment, when the airspeed exceeds 30m/s and the altitude is greater than 15m, it transitions to the takeoff departure segment, with a softening time limit set to 2s.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor airspeed and altitude in real time to ensure accurate transition to the takeoff departure segment when the airspeed is greater than 30m/s and the altitude is greater than 15m.
The system should verify the accuracy of the softening time limit set to 2s, and make corrections or issue an alert if the conditions are not met.
The system should perform a self-check during state transitions to ensure that all relevant parameters and functional modules operate normally.

requirement: During the takeoff departure segment, when the flight altitude exceeds the Safety height of 80m, it transitions to climb segment 1. The elevator channel uses the method of softening the initial value of the integrator, while other channels do not require softening.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that when the flight altitude is greater than 80m above Safety altitude, it accurately transitions to climb segment 1 and correctly applies the softening method for the initial value of the elevator channel integrator.
The system should monitor the flight altitude in real time to ensure that when the safety height of 80m is reached or exceeded, the logic for transitioning to Climb Segment 1 is triggered promptly.

The system should verify the correctness of the softening method for the initial values of the elevator channel integrator to ensure that it does not introduce additional control errors during the transition process.
The system should ensure that during the climb 1 segment, the control logic of other channels is not affected by the integrator initial value softening method, maintaining stability and Safety.

requirement: In segment 1 of the climb, start retracting the landing gear. If the landing gear is retracted, delay for 5 seconds before starting to retract the flaps; if after 1 minute the landing gear is still not retracted, then directly set the flaps to 0 degrees. If the flaps are retracted to 0 degrees, after a 5-second delay, transition to segment 2 of the climb; if more than 75 seconds have elapsed since entering segment 1 and the flaps are still not at 0 degrees, then directly transition to segment 2 of the climb. When transitioning to segment 2, the soft time limit is 2 seconds.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the retraction operations of the landing gear and flaps are carried out according to the preset time sequence after the start of segment 1 climb, and automatically execute subsequent operations in case of a timeout.
The system should monitor the status of the landing gear and flaps in real time, ensuring that if the landing gear is not retracted on time, the flaps will automatically retract to 0 degrees.
The system should ensure that after the flaps are set to 0 degrees, it transitions to Climb Phase 2 according to the preset delay time, and automatically transitions in case of a timeout.
The system should ensure that when transitioning to climb segment 2, the softening time limit is 2s, to avoid drastic changes during the state transition.

The system should set up a timeout warning mechanism. When the time for segment 1 climbing exceeds 75s or the transition to segment 2 climbing exceeds the softening time limit, the warning should be triggered and the abnormal state should be recorded.

requirement: After climbing 2 segments, if the aircraft has not stalled, handle according to the value of DH, the difference between the current altitude and the desired altitude: 1) If DH>10m, switch to the descent segment, set the softening time limit to 2s, and soften the elevator channel by setting the initial value of the integrator for softening. 2) If -10m≤DH≤10m, switch to the constant altitude segment, with the softening time limit set to 2s.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor in real-time whether the aircraft is stalling and, if not stalling, perform correct state transitions based on the height difference DH.
The system should ensure that when DH>10m, it transitions to the descent phase and correctly sets the softening time limit and the initial value of the integrator for the elevator channel.
The system should ensure that when -10m≤DH≤10m, it transitions to the fixed height segment and correctly sets the softening time.

The system should perform real-time consistency checks during state transitions to ensure that the settings for softening time limits and initial integrator values meet expectations, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: Initialize the altitude hold controller integrator, the altitude tracking controller integrator, and the throttle controller integrator (calculate the initial value of the throttle controller integrator based on a throttle position of 100%) to prepare for altitude hold control and altitude tracking control.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the initial settings of the altitude control integrator, the height tracking integrator, and the throttle control integrator to ensure they are accurate and consistent with the calculation results for a throttle position of 100%.
The system should monitor the softening process of the integrator's initial value to ensure that the softening operation does not lead to abnormal control parameters or system instability.

The system should perform a self-check after the integrator initial value settings are completed to ensure that all control parameters have been correctly initialized, preparing for altitude hold control and altitude tracking control.

requirement: The FCC collects necessary aircraft motion information, compares it with the required motion to obtain the deviation between the actual and ideal motion of the aircraft. It then calculates control signals based on this deviation by solving control laws, and inputs these control signals into the relevant servos to make the control surfaces deflect in a certain pattern, thereby achieving control of the aircraft's attitude and motion.
safety_requirements: The FCC should ensure the accuracy and integrity of the aircraft motion data collected, preventing data from being tampered with or lost.
FCC should perform real-time monitoring of the deviation between actual movement and ideal movement, and trigger warnings or corrective mechanisms when the deviation exceeds the Safety range.
